multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Dermatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Ask different questions to cover more information. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I've been experiencing progressive hair loss on my head over the past 2 months.
Have you noticed any changes in the texture or color of your remaining hair?
No, there haven't been any changes in the texture or color of my remaining hair.
Do you have any patches where the hair loss is particularly noticeable, or is it more general thinning?
I have noticeable hairless patches on my head.
Are the edges of these patches smooth or ragged?
The edges of the patches are ill-defined.
Have you been experiencing any itching or pain in the areas where you've lost hair?
No, I haven't experienced any itching or pain in the areas where I've lost hair.
Do you have a history of autoimmune diseases, or does anyone in your family have similar hair loss or autoimmune conditions?
No, there is no personal or family history of serious illness, including autoimmune diseases.
Have you started any new medications or treatments in the last few months prior to noticing the hair loss?
No, I have not started any new medications or treatments recently.
**Final Diagnosis:** Alopecia Areata
